android.mercury
Class Mercury

java.lang.Object
  android.mercury.Mercury

public class Mercury
extends java.lang.Object

The Mercury is an object that allows to execute three types of requests (system, user and transaction) to the Moms API.

Constructor Summary
Mercury(int clientId, java.lang.String token)
          Constructs a new Mercury.

Method Detail

ping

public Ping ping()
Tests connectivity to the Moms API servers.
 Code sample: 
 Ping myPing = myMercury.ping();

Returns:
A new Ping response object

send

public Send send(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Initiates a transaction and delivery of an SMS or MMS. 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("campaign_id", "xxxx");
 params.put("to", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 params.put("from", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 params.put("message", "Hello, World!");
 params.put("content_id", "xxxx")
 Send mySend = myMercury.send(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contain the following keys with their corresponding value:
  • "campaign_id" → "...": An ID connected to a specific campaign setup in the Campaign Manager or provided by your account representative.
  • "to" → "...": A 10-digit mobile phone number.
  • "from" → "...": A 10-digit mobile phone number.
  • "message" → "...": Depending on your campaign set up, the message presented to the "to" user.
  • "content_id" → "...": An ID associated to the content being sent (optional - depending on your campaign set up, this parameter may be required).
  • OR "content_url" → "...": underdevelopment - for users who host their own content
The HashMap can also contain the following optionnal key-value pairs:
  • "to_name" → "...": A name associated to the "to" mobile number (if not included will be set to "to" mobile number).
  • "from_name" → "...": A name associated to the "from" mobile number (if not included will be set to "from" mobile number).
  • "udp_*" → "...": User Defined Parameter. Clients can pass in any number of udp_* parameters for message flow customization.
Returns:
A new Send response object

lookup

public Lookup lookup(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Returns the info, status and history of the requested transaction. 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("message_id", "xxxx");
 params.put("hash", "xxxx");
 Lookup myLookup = myMercury.lookup(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following keys with their corresponding value:
  • "message_id" → "...": An ID returned from a send(java.util.HashMap) or from transactions(java.util.HashMap) method.
  • "hash" → "...": A hash returned from a send(java.util.HashMap) or from a transactions(java.util.HashMap) method.
Returns:
A new Lookup response object

getopt

public Getopt getopt(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Returns the opt in status of any mobile number. 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("number", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 Getopt myGetopt = myMercury.getopt(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following keys with their corresponding value:
  • "number" → "...": A 10-digit mobile phone number.
The HashMap can also contain the following optionnal key-value pairs:
  • "campaign_id" → "...": A campaign id to search on, if excluded, returns all opt in statuses for the client's campaigns.
Returns:
A new Getopt response object

setopt

public Setopt setopt(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Sets the opt in status of any mobile number. 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("number", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 params.put("campaign_id", "xxxx");
 params.put("status_code", "xxxx");
 Setopt mySetopt = myMercury.setopt(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following keys with their corresponding value:
  • "number" → "...": A 10-digit mobile phone number.
  • "campaign_id" → "...": An ID connected to a specific campaign setup in the Campaign Manager or provided by your account representative.
  • "status_code" → "...": See the bellow table for available codes to use here.
Status Status code Description
OPTEDIN 1 User is opted into the campaign
OPTEDOUT -2 User is opted out of the campaign

Returns:
A new Setopt response object

uncache

public Uncache uncache(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Clears the user carrier and handset info from the Mogreet cache. 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("number", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 Uncache myUncache = myMercury.uncache(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following key with its corresponding value:
  • "number" → "...": A 10-digit phone number.
Returns:
A new Uncache response object

 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("number", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 Info myInfo = myMercury.info(params);

hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following key with its corresponding value:
  • "number" → "...": A 10-digit phone number.

transactions

public Transactions transactions(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hash)
Returns the user's transactions (open and closed). 
 Code sample: 
 HashMap params = new HashMap();
 params.put("number", "xxxxxxxxxx");
 Transactions myTransactions = myMercury.transactions(params);

Parameters:
hash - A HashMap object that must contains the following key with its corresponding value:
  • "number" → "...": A 10-digit phone number.
The HashMap can also contain the following optionnal key-value pairs:
  • "campaign_id" → "...": A campaign id to search on, if excluded, returns all transactions for the client's campaigns.
  • "start_date" → "...": Narrow search by adding a date to start searching on (YYYY-MM-DD).
  • "end_date" → "...": Narrow search by adding a date to stop searching on (YYYY-MM-DD).
Returns:
A new Transactions response object
